headline: Trump’s Venezuela Oil Revival Plan Is a $100 Billion Gamble
summary: Rebuilding it enough to lift Venezuela’s output back to its peak levels of the 1970s would require companies that could include Chevron Corp., Exxon Mobil Corp. and ConocoPhillips to invest about $10 billion per year over the next decade, said Francisco Monaldi, director of Latin American energy policy at Rice University’s Baker Institute for Public Policy.  Venezuela sits atop the world’s largest oil reserves.  US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said during an interview with ABC Sunday that he expects US oil companies will be eager for the opportunity to drill for Venezuela’s heavy crude, which is key for refineries on the US Gulf Coast.

content.title: Trump’s Venezuela Oil Revival Plan Is a $100 Billion Gamble
content.summary: Rebuilding it enough to lift Venezuela’s output back to its peak levels of the 1970s would require companies that could include Chevron Corp., Exxon Mobil Corp. and ConocoPhillips to invest about $10 billion per year over the next decade, said Francisco Monaldi, director of Latin American energy policy at Rice University’s Baker Institute for Public Policy.  Venezuela sits atop the world’s largest oil reserves.  US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said during an interview with ABC Sunday that he expects US oil companies will be eager for the opportunity to drill for Venezuela’s heavy crude, which is key for refineries on the US Gulf Coast.

headline: U.S. oil stocks explode after Trump’s actions, comments on Venezuela

headline: Chevron, Oil Stocks Rally as Trump Says US to Run Venezuela
summary: ConocoPhillips and Exxon Mobil Corp. also rose. (CSE: CUH) ("Copperhead" or the "Company") announces that Kevin Zhou has resigned as an officer of the Company. The Company thanks Mr. Zhou for his contributions and service. summary: Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) and related stocks rise following the US invasion of Venezuela and capture of President Nicolás Maduro. CES 2026 kicks off today in Las Vegas with presentations from Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) CEO Lisa Su. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Venezuela oil: Energy giants likely to invest in infrastructure
summary: Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) are rising Monday morning following President Trump's ousting of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro over the weekend. Energy giants are already looking to invest billions of dollars into reviving Venezuela's oil market and rebuilding its oil infrastructure. Hedgeye Risk Management energy analyst Fernando Valle lists the operators and refiners, like Chevron (CVX) and Exxon Mobil (XOM), who would have so much to gain from this opportunity. China — one of Venezuela's biggest trade allies for oil — has condemned the invasion. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.description:
Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) are rising Monday morning following President Trump's ousting of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro over the weekend. Energy giants are already looking to invest billions of dollars into reviving Venezuela's oil market and rebuilding its oil infrastructure.

Hedgeye Risk Management energy analyst Fernando Valle lists the operators and refiners, like Chevron (CVX) and Exxon Mobil (XOM), who would have so much to gain from this opportunity.

China — one of Venezuela's biggest trade allies for oil — has condemned the invasion.

headline: Wall Street gains ground as crude prices and oil company stocks rise after the US raid on Venezuela
summary: Stocks rose in afternoon trading on Wall Street Monday to kick off the first full week of the new year, led by a mix of big energy and technology companies.  Energy companies and the oil market were a key focus after U.S. forces captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro in a weekend raid.  The price of Brent crude, the international standard, rose 1.5% to $61.66 per barrel.

content.title: Wall Street gains ground as crude prices and oil company stocks rise after the US raid on Venezuela
content.summary: Stocks rose in afternoon trading on Wall Street Monday to kick off the first full week of the new year, led by a mix of big energy and technology companies.  Energy companies and the oil market were a key focus after U.S. forces captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro in a weekend raid.  The price of Brent crude, the international standard, rose 1.5% to $61.66 per barrel.

headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Chevron, Versant, Bed Bath, AMD
summary: ↗️ Trump Media (DJT): Shares in President Trump's social-media company rose 4.5% Monday. The U.S. ousted Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro over the weekend and Trump pledged to dispatch U.S. drillers to revive Venezuela's crude output.

content.title: Stocks to Watch Recap: Chevron, Versant, Bed Bath, AMD

headline: Stock Market Today, Jan. 5: Dow Hits Record High on Energy Stocks Rally After Venezuela Developments
summary: Today, Jan. 5, 2026, energy giants and banks are steering Wall Street higher as traders frame Venezuela's turmoil as an investment opening.
